title: Riot I think you should take a look as this sums up everything.

embed.description: League of Legends has been around for 9 years, but so many fans have quit, stopped playing, or lost their passion for the game. I'm here to explain to you why that is and what happened to League of Legends. _____TIME STAMPS_____ 0:00 - Introduction 1:54 - Change Everything!

body:
This video is by The Act Man and he has some concerns for league and the gameplay and how it's changing I totally agree with all that he says. I would say from looking at the boards his view is a sum of what everyone is saying. Maybe its time you listen to the community.

I want to be able to play who I want and still have a chance even if it's not meta if I play them with skill. 

I want fun champions again and skins for all champions. 

I don't want a map change. 

I don't want a rework for every champ every month. 

 I want fun game modes back not just ARAM and SR. 

I want to be able to play without everyone getting pissed after one mistake because now one mistake costs the game no matter what it is. 

**I want fun in back in league again.**

Right so I'm not going to waste my day going back and forth with this because you won't watch a video to explain what I'm saying so I'll just leave you with this. 

If you did watch the video by the "joe nodbody" who has valid points you'd hear how the "engaging game design" might work but is overall bad for the game and that the changes that address a new and underlying concern are often caused by the changes themselves then creating a cycle. 

So if you want to see it from both sides and not be ignorant I suggest watching the video. 

All I'm saying.

I do see it from both sides. I don’t have to watch that video though. I still agree with what Riot is doing to improve the game despite the push back from the people who can only see things in the short term than the long term.

But if you are a small picture kind of guy, then yea, I see where your frustrations are. But you need to look at changes from a broader perspective than drink whatever koolaid “the act man” wants to you to drink.

Riot doesn’t make changes based on a per week basis. They have short and long term plans. It’s easy to make a YouTube video to whine. It’s tough to strategize and plan out changes for the long term.

Rito pls :,(

I want the game I know and love back

I do have to point out that it is a double edged sword. Change is inevitable and without change many people will grow tired of the game and move on. At the same time many people do not like change and want what they are used to and like the game from a specific state. There will never be pleasing all of the sides as much as that is the goal

I rememeber some things like Dominion and about "catch the Teemo." A game I really enjoyed exclusively on Dominion. And for the most part it was very fun until Riot decided to remove it. I also had some champs they did have reworks I enjoyed but then there are some champions reworks that are so complicated that I don't even understand. Yea... I think change for the most part has been a pain in the backside, and I guess for the most part the changes that we ever need aren't as prevalent as all the crazy changes and mechanics Riot has unnecessarily implemented. I have been TRYING, been TRYING to be as innovative as I can on ARAM (the only game I enjoy for the most part) and still I get beaten down by certain champs I hate going against at times.

I did pick up {{champion:163}} lately and she's been a really good solid champion for me (for the most part it was even fun on ARAM at times) and now with 8.11 they gutted her ult, made her q not AOE. (I thought Tali was op by then) I started realizing that league of Randomness is not the same to me as it once did, when you pick and try to innovate instead of Riot trying to pigeon-hole things out of existance and make them even more boring to play (mostly adcs because it's all the same to me, sure {{champion:96}} is different from {{champion:119}} but that's mostly because of the aa's thing.)

Most of my matchups have been... very sad lately and some changes to popular champs have not been fixed while the "unpopular" have been gutted, reshaped, hardly crafted, and even twisted their kits. Yea Galio feels more like a generic hero gargoyle type of thing. {{champion:41}} is still salty but never the same as the old one.

Too much change is unfun, and I get it from him.

I want dominion back... make it better for some players who enjoyed it.

{{champion:163}}

Aatrox main here, I don't play him anymore since about a month ago because I can't bear to think that in a while he's going to be completely scrapped and all the effort I put into learning him, his kit, every little detail about the champion is going to change. And this comes at a time where he is not a bad champion. It just doesn't feel good at all.

coming from a old Yorick Main:
 Squeeze out every little second of Playtime and Enjoyment out of him while you still can. After the rework you will **_never _**be able to do anything with him again, as he will be replaced by someone with the same name.

Its almost the same Feeling like visiting your Grandparents often since you know they wont do it for much longer, but a bit worse since you have a fixed "Day of Death" -> Patch Day of the Rework
Can relate {{champion:91}}

Also I'd like to take this time to mention that the assassin update was a mistake, and that devoting an update purely to cater to a low elo audience is not a change that myself and other players liked to see.

I saw this video yesterday and it definitely echoes a lot of what I have been feeling lately. Really hope a few members of Riot watch this video to understand why so many players have not been happy with this season.

In particular, the part on reworks really touches me as someone who used to love playing the old Galio. I get that a lot of players love to see new VGUs but they don't have any sympathy for the players who already love that champion. Nobody understands how devastating reworks are until their favorite champion gets reworked because they don't relate to players who play champions that they personally don't care about.

Change just for the sake of change isn't good.

And that's what league is. Riot is changing the game for the sake of change. 

So far every modern champion rework since WW has evolved them into more toxic designs than before. Honestly I think they were fine. They were all good in their own way. Now we have new WW :/. And Galio was super good until he was nerfed underground. New Irelia is more toxic than old Irelia. Sucks

The problem is they are reworking the same champions instead of working on the ones that really need it. I don't mind VGU and we need more. I have a problem when they don't take anything into consideration when they work on a champion. Karma.
Everyone who ever makes a video like that (or a post like this) should title it "I HATE CHANGE!"
